course_title: Econometrics of Policy- Analysis & Causal Inference
course_description: This is an applied microeconometrics course with a central focus on causal inference and empirical analysis. As part of this course, you will complete an empirical research project using raw data and employ econometric methods to analyze a research question relevant to contemporary microeconomic policies. You will also present your final work to the class. The content of the course is split into two general areas: 1) acquisition, compilation, and management of real world panel data; and 2) empirical methods in program evaluation and causal inference.
